legacy_frameworks.name: MSMQ (Microsoft Message Queue)
legacy_frameworks.target: Azure Service Bus or Azure Storage Queues

web_technologies.name: ASP.NET Web Forms elements
web_technologies.notes: Using Razor views with MVC pattern

dependencies.name: System.ServiceModel
dependencies.replacement: gRPC.AspNetCore or ASP.NET Core Web API

projects.name: ProductCatalog
migration_blockers: MSMQ queue operations need cloud alternative

projects.name: ProductServiceLibrary
projects.target_type: gRPC Service or ASP.NET Core Web API

projects.name: OrderProcessor
projects.target_type: Background Worker / Azure Container App Job
migration_blockers: MSMQ dependency needs cloud queue replacement

summary: ProductCatalogApp is a .NET Framework 4.8.1 solution with three components: an ASP.NET MVC 5 web application, a WCF service library, and an MSMQ-based order processor. Migration to .NET 10 and Azure Container Apps requires replacing legacy Windows-specific technologies (WCF, MSMQ) with cloud-native alternatives.
risks: WCF service contracts may have complex behaviors that need careful mapping to REST/gRPC
MSMQ transactional behavior needs equivalent in Azure Service Bus
View rendering may have subtle differences between ASP.NET MVC and ASP.NET Core
Session state management needs cloud-compatible solution

immediate: Create new .NET 10 projects using modern SDK-style csproj format
Replace WCF ProductService with ASP.NET Core Web API or gRPC
Replace MSMQ with Azure Service Bus queues
Migrate ASP.NET MVC to ASP.NET Core MVC
infrastructure: Use Azure Container Apps for hosting all services
Use Azure Service Bus for asynchronous order processing
Use Azure Container Registry for container images
Consider Azure SQL Database or Cosmos DB for data persistence
Use Azure Application Insights for monitoring
architecture: Keep the three-tier architecture (Web, Service, Processor)
Use REST or gRPC for inter-service communication
Implement health checks for container orchestration
Use configuration from environment variables/Azure App Configuration
Implement proper logging with structured logging
